channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Scenario Planning, Foresight, and the Power of Imagination: Navigating an Uncertain Future
item.description: By fostering resilience through the consideration of various outcomes, investment practitioners can better anticipate and manage the complexities and disruptions that characterize today's dynamic environment.

item.title: It’s not the Fed’s job to make the stock market ‘comfortable’ says Fed president
item.description: Analysts holding out for the Fed to rescue the stock market might be waiting in vain

item.title: Private Equity: In Essence, Plunder?
item.description: To understand what private equity is at its worst is a call to action, personally and professionally.

item.title: 4 die and over 1,600 flights cancelled after Tropical Storm Debby slams Florida
item.description: Debby made landfall along the Gulf Coast of Florida early Monday as a Category 1 hurricane. It since has weakened to a tropical storm and is moving slowly.

item.title: Small Caps, Large Caps, and Interest Rates
item.description: The relationship between stocks and interest rates is not reliably stable. There are periods when equities are highly rate sensitive, and periods when they aren't.

item.title: Pope Francis reveals his summer reading list and love for tragedies as he encourages young priests to read a ‘good’ book
item.description: In his letter the Pope made references to literary greats like C.S. Lewis, Marcel Proust, T. S. Eliot and fellow Argentinian Jorge Luis Borges.

item.title: How Well Does the Market Predict Volatility?
item.description: How accurate is VIX on a realized basis and when does it diverge with the market?

item.title: Olympic boxer Imane Khelif hailed a ‘heroine’ by her home village despite gender row
item.description: Imane has found herself in the middle of a heated global row after it emerged that she had previously failed unspecified gender eligibility tests.

item.title: What Do Experts Really Know? Embracing the Unknown
item.description: Confidence is a necessary but insufficient factor in long-term investing success. Raising the metaknowledge quotient of the investment team can help protect against the surprises that lurk in left-tail events and remain unknown, until they’re known.

item.title: IBM’s former head of AI says Big Tech needs to end arms race in LLMs to ditch its carbon backpack
item.description: Seth Dobrin favors energy-efficient small language models and calls for a new ‘paradigm of cooling’ to solve AI's growing sustainability dilemma.
